availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, merchant. Illinois native. Married to Mary A. Wilcox. Father of James H. G. Wilcox. Clerk in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Paducah in 1860. Employed William H. Wilcox as a clerk in Paducah in 1860. Employed Mary Craft as a domestic servant in Paducah in 1860. Employed Dan Bean as a wagoner in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 152B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, District 1, p. 935.
Find A Grave, "D. C. Wilcox (1828-1894)," Memorial #84490335, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84490335 (accessed January 26, 2021).
